description:
The Partnership Manager is a strongly motivated sales professional that works closely with local businesses in Orange County to build local relationships with OC businesses, organizations and drive retail revenue through event production and promotions. This person needs to be based within the territory that has experience marketing and selling a cannabis retail brand and lives for the thrill of knocking down doors and increasing market share. You will be representing a high end cannabis retailer during an exciting time of product and company expansion.

Job Responsibilities

  • Reach out to prospective accounts.
  • Maintain current accounts and increase volume.
  • Keep menus up to date and distribute to clients.
  • Track KPIs and incorporate reports into sales strategy.
  • Regular meetings with the team and higher ups to discuss activity.
  • Support clients with inventory and related assets including discount pricing plans.
  • Invite every encounter as an opportunity to promote the brand mission and serve as a solution provider to partners.
  • Juggle conflicting priorities and tasks using strong time management skills.
  • Be a supportive leader to encourage a collaborative environment across teams.
  • Offer a customer oriented approach rooted in passion for benefitting peoples' lives through cannabis.

Salary

$75000 - $85000 USD per year

Required Skills

  • 2+ years of outside sales experience.
  • Bachelor's degree.
  • Strong work ethic and communication skills.
  • Ability to travel in order to do business.
  • Ability to take a data driven approach to sales in order to boost quantity and quality.
  • Ability to learn new responsibilities and grow into a larger management role.
  • Creative quick thinking to serve as a problem solver with a positive outlook.
  • Team player, though also independent and self motivated.
  • Performance driven to exceed sales goals.

Desired Skills

  • Experience working in the cannabis industry (flower sales preferred).
  • Background in alcohol wine & spirits sales.
  • Background in pharmaceutical sales.
  • A current book of business and strong relationships with buyers/retailers specifically in the territory.
  • Knowledge of the state’s cannabis regulations.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office suite and customer relationship management software.

About FlowerHire

Our client is an Orange County based retail group who has upleveled the cannabis customer experience and prides itself on quality and service to the local community.

Benefits

Equal opportunity employer

FlowerHire is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.
